snippet: According to mounting scientific evidence, the prevalence of post-traumatic stress syndrome among veterans of recent wars is substantially lower than is commonly believed.
abstract: Op-Ed article by psychology Prof Anthony D Mancini asserts that according to mounting scientific evidence, the prevalence of post-traumatic stress syndrome among veterans of recent wars is substantially lower than is commonly believed; observes that a forthright recognition of the human capacity for resilience does no disservice to the afflicted.
